website_summaries.verdict: The Pizza Co. game is one of the more popular Osmo add-ons, since it provides real world experience along with math comprehension skills.
pros: Provides a real-life restaurant simulation for young players
Introduces mathematical concepts in a non-math environment
Difficulty level is adjustable for various players
cons: Software "freezes" are a common issue with players
App may not recognize proper placement of game pieces

customer_reviews.title: Don't tell the kids- we play this when they sleep.
customer_reviews.text: This is so much fun that my husband and I play it- when the kids are in bed! (Shhh! Don't tell them.) I have nearly broken a sweat a few times when my shop was crowded, but don't worry, you can change the mode so that a five year old can play. The setting will allow the timer to be off, and so that only dollar bills will be used in making change, no coins, if you want. Honestly, I hope the shop owner doesn't ever come back from vacation! Please buy this, it truly such a joy to play.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany R.

customer_reviews.title: Another wonderful OSMO product
customer_reviews.text: This pizza company game is another wonderful edition to the Osmo family. It is super cute and educational. I really like the junior mode because it allows preschoolers to play with minimal assistance. We have been using OSMO since the firs year it came out and we all love it. It grows with your child and makes the iPad an active tool for learning instead of a video player. I highly recommend the Pizza company simply for the money skills alone since schools don’t cover this skill any more. Plus reading facial expressions and following directions is a lifelong skill kiddo need. Two thumbs up to OSMO.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: The reflector doesn't recognize the pizza
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate this a zero I would the reflector doesn't recognize the game pieces so the animal just stands there making goofy noises while my daughter and I get frustrated with the game. great concept but poor coding execution, there needs to be more regression testing done on this product and please peer review the code before submitting. properly set-up a dev, test and production environment and fully test this product just before selling it and getting bad reviews not a good way to brand the company speaks volume about the company which is not a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better for older kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a younger child and it's okay. They have only used to 'make' pizzas vs. the money component. Also, the animals speak in nonsense sounds. I had to ask others that have purchased this product to make sure that this one wasn't defective. Personally, I think it takes a while for younger kids to catch on. And there were some issues with trying clear the pizzas for the next customer. There doesn't seem to be enough space for the ipad to register that the pizza was finished and ready for the next order.
customer_reviews.author: sev619

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game for logic and math development!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is obsessed with pizza. I mean, if every item in the world could be made of pizza, that's his heaven right there. I saw this game and thought "let's focus that pizza frenzy". It's worked. He loves this game. It's a fun concept of working out the visual logic of object placement and reading the emotional and vocal cues of the "customers", and then working out the math of the money they pay versus the amount of change they are due. There are several levels of difficulty, from whole numbers down to cents. It's fantastic. The visuals are engaging and the rewards keep kids playing. It doesn't' feel like homework, but there's serious learning happening. 5+stars.
customer_reviews.author: I'm me

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: The osmo system game and art packs are somewhat expensive. The quality of items included with the packs are okay, not the best but would expect more at this price point. Also easy to loose parts if not careful, need to use this with the ipad without a protective cover. I think that is part of the drawback for this game, I have a hard time with my kids using the ipad without a protective cover. When we have taken off in the past the two ipads we had ended up getting cracked. So with our new ipad we don't let our daughter use for this activity. Wish the base was usable with the ipad and it's protective case.
customer_reviews.author: Lovz 2 Shop

customer_reviews.title: Fun, cooperative play, learn about money
customer_reviews.text: This is such a hit. I purchased it for my grandchildren. They are homeschooling due to the pandemic and hurry through with school so they can play the pizza game again. Siblings can help each other so it’s great for cooperative play. My 3 year old grandson helps pick out the pizza toppings while my granddaughter applies them to the pizza. Then they have to make change. Great concept that helps teach them about money. She is 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Nocturnal Nook

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn’t love pizza???
customer_reviews.text: What an interesting way to teach little kids!!! This interactive pizza game is so much fun!!! Our daughter loves it. Our son has yet to play with his but I’m sure he will come around like our daughter has LoL Great game though. Really like that not only can you make your own pizza but it helps teaches about money as well
customer_reviews.author: rylee and maile

customer_reviews.title: So fun! Even for adults.
customer_reviews.text: Gifted to an 8-year old. A lot of fun, even for adults, and teaches on-the spot calculations of currency, going as minute as 5-cent increments for giving change, which could be challenging for older kids, too. Overall, very well made game, and very quick-paced, teaching the basics of running a business, paying rent, upgrading equipment, decorating, customer feedback, tipping, in a fun pizza-making context. The only negative so far is that the 2nd generation iPad takes a few seconds to process pizza toppings, which results in lower game scores sometimes, unless you are aware of it and wait accordingly to accommodate. But that could be the iPad issue, not a game issue.
customer_reviews.author: katttro

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Osmo Addition
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves Osmo and the Pizza Co. Game was another great addition to her ever growing collection. She loves making the pizzas (assembling the toppings) but the only frustrating part for her is handling the change. You can adjust how difficult the change system is (dollars only vs. dollars and coins, etc.) but this aspect of the game still stresses her out so I usually serve as the cashier while she handles the pizzas. I'm sure when she's got a better handle on math, this will no longer be an issue. Overall, happy with the purchase and the quality of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Kids didn't like how fast-paced this game is
customer_reviews.text: This game is a big timed. You've got customers coming in the store wanting you to make a pizza and then ones that are waiting to pay. You have to continually flip the pizza pie/pan over to pay or make the pizza. The customers will get unhappy if they have to wait too long. My kids ages 5, 7 and 9 didn't like how fast-paced this game needed to be to keep the customers happy. I thought it was fun and challenging but the kids weren't so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: cg0rle

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect STEM Toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect STEM Toy. I can not love this product more. I bought this for my 5 year old daughter to help with fractions. The product works flawlessly with the Ipad. It has great game pieces. The interaction of the Ipad and game pieces is flawless. The program has built in A.I. that promotes growth in learning and helps the kids progress with positive reinforcement. This is the Future of schooling and all learning warped into a Toy product that is fun to use. I would recommend this product to all of my friends for kids ages 3-10.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Kunkle

customer_reviews.title: Osmo is so-so
customer_reviews.text: We’re just feeling kind of so-so about all the Osmo apps and games. Great ideas but just not ready yet. Poor directions, requires very bright direct light, the fact that you have to take case off tablets, kind of a lot of work for the amount of fun to be had... we haven’t decided if it’s worth it or will be keeping any of them. Awesome concept just poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Werger

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun for parents too!
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I love this game. The difficulty of the game increases quickly though, so the smaller children get outpaced by the game sooner than I would like. But the game is great for my older one who is learning to count change. And parents... no shame in playing this game on your own. It’s actually kind of fun. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Mason's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Current favorite Osmo game
customer_reviews.text: Currently our favorite Osmo game. My boys are 4 and 9 and both enjoy this game. It’s nice how easy it is to switch difficulty even mid-game. They enjoy hunting for bad guys and I enjoy watching them develop listening and thinking skills. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: MsSunshine1017

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite Osmo game so far
customer_reviews.text: This game is addicting! There are many similar games online so you have likely played some version of it before. You make pizzas for customers and then make change for them. You can choose how hard to make the change part so it is great for younger kids and not too easy for older ones. It is challenging and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Junior mode is great for three and four year olds!!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the games and activities this is my three and four year old favorite. They run their own pizza shop and have customers that order specific toppings for them to make. There is a junior mode that makes it a little easier for the little ones. If you have an Osmo and younger kids, this is well worth adding to your games.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids to learn about money and math
customer_reviews.text: This is such a creative way to make math look like fun. Great for kids to learn about money and helps them become quicker at doing math in their heads. My son loves this game. Its also good because as you go it gets harder goes from dollars in the beginning for giving change to quarters to dimes to all sorts of change combinations. He cant get enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: I love this game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! The only quibble I have is that the pizza is folded in half! And I get it for packaging purposes. Except could you please please please offer a WHOLE pizza to buy. Cause this pizza makes the game kind of glitchy which no one will appreciate especially when you are trying to aim for "speed". Whole pizza option would be awesome! Otherwise this game really impressed me.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Ranney

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to go with my 5 yr. old granddaughter's Osmo base that she got for Christmas. I love that the varied math levels will adjust with her abilities. She loves playing it with her dad. Currently they are using Dollar bills & making change for pizza orders. As her math abilities advance, so will the game. Delighted that she's excited about it. Looking forward to playing it with her when I visit.
customer_reviews.author: SLT

customer_reviews.title: Shhhhh - I’m playing and my kids aren’t even home...
customer_reviews.text: This “game” is fun! My son was using the OSMO tangrams program at school STEM session. I bought the pizza co for Christmas and we can’t stop playing! You make pizzas to order, give change to customers... it really is fun. We got the genius starter kit and this game, my 6 & 10 year olds like it a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Noone

customer_reviews.title: winner winner chicken dinner!! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My girls love love osmo!! This hands on game is perfect for teaching them how to count, add, subtract, and the value of money while playing hands on. If your looking for a easy travel hands on learning osmo is it!! I can go on and on about how it is worth the investment you will be putting in to their education l.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning game for my 6&8yo boys
customer_reviews.text: My kids love osmo and then I don’t have to feel bad about them being on a screen this one is a fun one and teaches them about counting money and addition/subtraction. We also make pizza at home and they love that it’s similar. My boys are 6&8 and even my 8 year old has fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Rouga omar

customer_reviews.title: Fun mix of tech and reality
customer_reviews.text: I like that as your kids get better, the game can grow with them providing greater challenges. I also love the way technology merges with physical game pieces. There was another reviewer that confessed to playing after her kids went to bed. I also enjoyed the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Z

customer_reviews.title: Great game for learning how to work with money!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! Even I enjoyed playing it, and I’m 32 years old. My daughter (she’s 10) asked for this specifically after she got the starter set for Xmas. She plays it all the time and absolutely loves it! It’s been great for learning how to make change and work with money.
customer_reviews.author: Sara7787

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I just wasn't impressed by this game. Instructions are unclear while playing the game and unless your child can already read they will need assistance with it. Also, the characters speak in jiberish, I think it would have been better had they had the character speak in English etc with directions.
customer_reviews.author: Kala Ditler

customer_reviews.title: Cute game
customer_reviews.text: Love this game so much I just wish they made the coins more realistic so my daughter would learn what each piece looks like in really life ...
customer_reviews.author: tiffany martin

customer_reviews.title: Another great game from OSMO!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 and 4 year olds love this game! It's fun to try to please your customers and get their pizza orders right and fast! My older one surprised me at how quickly she picked up on giving her customers change when they pay their bills. I like that you can keep the math simple (dollars only) or up the difficulty by allowing customers to require dollars and change when they pay. Fun and educational. Another win for OSMO!
customer_reviews.author: Lollipop Mamma

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME for multiple ages.
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this. Easy enough that my 4 year old can play with guidance. But the difficulty can be increased for my 9 year old. I love that she’s learning to handle and count back money (while refreshing those math skills too!) Every once in a while it will read the incorrect topping or won’t pick up that one has been added or removed but really no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: AshleyM

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my five year old. He loves it and so do I! I love that you can adjust the game to fit the child. I started him off with just making pizzas. Then he wanted the challenge of also dealing with money, so I put him on the dollars only setting. After he got comfortable with that, I bumped it up again. He loves playing this and I love that he's challenged and learning as he plays. I also enjoy playing!
customer_reviews.author: Megan L

customer_reviews.title: Running a business
customer_reviews.text: My kids love to run their pizza business together. I love playing with them too, it’s teaching them so much about running a business. They debated a new pizza oven or decor for about five minutes, something I never thought I’d hear a 5 and 7 year old doing! Love osmo!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent educational & Teaches $$
customer_reviews.text: My young grandchildren love this game. They are learning and mastering money, organization, and how to deal with the public. This is a way to help children understand what a fast food pizza job feels like. High quality product
customer_reviews.author: SkeensOly

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for Developing Young Business People
customer_reviews.text: This game teaches a lot of great life skills. Very easy to set up. Teaches kids about setting good quality standards, making change, time management, and how to invest in a business. My 7 year old learned a lot in the short time that she was playing with it. Will be using this toy to help develop management and business skills in my kids. Highly recommend for all ages, kids to adults.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Broken: Do not buy: Tells kids they have the wrong answer when correct
customer_reviews.text: I feel cheated by this app. The concept is good. The whole thing is brought down by the fact that 20% of the time the app doesn’t properly recognize the placed pizza toppings. So your kid does it perfectly and then is greater with a “sad face” and they don’t understand why. This is a big deal and really destroys the entire value of the game. Don’t buy unless they fix this core concept. Lesser feedback, I don’t know why they don’t let you slow it down or have an untimed mode or at least a pause option for younger kids / teaching. At least I couldn’t figure out how to give my kid more time.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: kids lost interest
customer_reviews.text: I loved this in concept, but my kids quickly lost interest. It's fun to make pizza and give out money, but they only play for about 15 minutes before loosing interest. Monster however, they could play for an hour if I let them.
customer_reviews.author: TXMama

customer_reviews.title: It’s great! So far their favorite Osmo game
customer_reviews.text: Kids can’t get enough of this! It’s great! So far their favorite Osmo game! Packaging is very nice. The app keeps crashing though?! Kids don’t mind, but it’s very annoying. Overall, I like the learning and hands on this provides. We homeschool, and it’s a good fun way to give them a paper break while the other if finishing type thing. Also, they just want to play it on their free time. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: momof2homeschool

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old really loves this game. It was a Christmas gift and he keeps going back to play it. It can be really sensitive about which half to cover with toppings and the people do not speak English but it doesn’t seem to bother him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: App is buggy, not really worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Kids don’t really like it and the game seems to have quite a few bugs that need to be worked out by Osmo. There is no untimed version, which is frustrating for smaller children. Even when the pieces are exact it won’t read it correctly and give them bad scores. Not really worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Megan M.

customer_reviews.title: Please Buy these for your kids!! They will be quiet for hours!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!! It’s the best iPad game ever... it’s so engaging, learning toy, and good quality for my kids! They love playing and learning. I bought almost all of their games, the drawing is also amazing and nice any person, kids or adults will enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ann Cecilio

customer_reviews.title: Making pizzas is fun!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my five year old. She likes making the pizzas. The pace gets a little quick and giving change isn’t the easiest for her yet but we are working on it. She is entertained more with this than the drawing osmo offers.
customer_reviews.author: Raegan Fierro

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite Osmo game yet
customer_reviews.text: We really like this set. My 7 year old loves making the pizzas and making change. My 4 year old loves the pizza only mode. I love the stackable containers that all of the sets come in. It makes it easy to keep track of all of the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! Not only is it a great learning tool for my 7 year old but I find it fun to play too. We love all the osmo stuff we got so far but this one is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: JessR

customer_reviews.title: Having fun while learning!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 and 9 year old love the osmo games! And I love that they’re actually learning while getting their much demanded electronic time! This game Let’s them be totally creative while learning, it’s a win win for us!
customer_reviews.author: Haleym4

customer_reviews.title: FUN LEARNING!
customer_reviews.text: Holds my 7 year old attention for at least an hour. She even took it on our spring break vacation to play with her friend. You have customers who order a pizza. You add pizza toppings to their specifications and then once you are done they pay you for their meal but you have to give them correct change. Sounds pretty easy right? Well customers keep coming and coming and you have to help ALL of them at the same time and if you don’t, they get angry.
customer_reviews.author: JM Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOY!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my great-niece's 6th birthday and she absolutely loves this game! She has played it consistently since I gave it to her, which is a pretty rare thing because she has so many toys!
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: SOOOO Cute & Educational!
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 year old was so excited to receive this at Christmas, and it's a cute game. She loves working on counting her money and working with the customers.
customer_reviews.author: AWard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for different age and skill levels
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7year old. He started at lower skill levels and now I'm noticing hes doing the math in his head not even using his hands to count change!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Needs better quality control
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my grandchildren from amazon and the pizza part was bent around the edge when we got it. I should have returned it but it was his birthday and was crying so I forgot and now too late to do anything with it just hope it lasts. They love Osmo. The quality of some of the games isn’t too good. They do work.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The storage box I received with the game did not include the pizza logo sticker. The pizza is off the screen when playing. Seems defective. Edit: Customer service is excellent. They sent me a new box immediately, and have asked for a pic of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: FUN, Challenging, creative, supports Money Skills
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this game! Our daughter was struggling with her money knowledge.... this game has helped her understand the logistics of money handling from a play base format. Has various setting to build confidence as they develop skills. Has options for siblings/friends to have their own store account. One of my favorite gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Big Mama O

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea but doesn’t always work as should
customer_reviews.text: I love this idea! It’s fun and educational and my daughter loved playing it but... it doesn’t always pick up the ingredients she puts on the pizza and it’s frustrating trying to move the pizza around in an effort to get the the game to read it.
customer_reviews.author: Jshaney

customer_reviews.title: Another great game from Osmo
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my girls for Easter and this is all they have played all day. It’s fun and engaging time after time. Love how Osmo creates such nice packaging for their products so games can easily be stored.
customer_reviews.author: MJN

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool. I love how it teaches them. The pizza company has customers that walk in, they make the pizza as ordered and take money and make change. My son is six and he is getting better everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P

customer_reviews.title: Great LEARNING toy
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids learning how to count money. My daughter loves this game and it makes learning FUN! I highly recommend this unit to anyone with kids learning how to count, add/subtract, etc. Even with the digital age, this is still a valuable skill kids need to learn and this unit does just that!
customer_reviews.author: the testers

customer_reviews.title: very cool "game" that sneaks in learning
customer_reviews.text: Our 5-year-old loves this! You can see how we can adjust the levels to meet his skills so he can definitely grow into this.
customer_reviews.author: Twins Mom

customer_reviews.title: Could've been great, but full of glitches.
customer_reviews.text: Game had so much potential and would've been fun to play if it didn't glitch constantly. Sent it back, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JNun

customer_reviews.title: Fun, educational
customer_reviews.text: My daughters have multiple Osmo games, but this is the one they play most often. They have expanded their entrepreneurial skills past this game.
customer_reviews.author: lab

customer_reviews.title: Perfect learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved it! And I loved that she was doing math and learning without even realizing it. She made it harder as she mastered levels
customer_reviews.author: eli

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning!!! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This OSMO game is AWESOME. My daughter loves it. I got it to teach her how to figure money and to count back change. Love the setup of this game. Easy and fun while learning.
customer_reviews.author: Cagoforth

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as we thought
customer_reviews.text: Over all good quality product, however my daughter just didn't have fun. Seemed a bit complicated for her (she is 6).
customer_reviews.author: Murdog

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk game.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about 2 days gameplay then it won’t sense the pizza going into the oven. Every other Osmo game works but for some reason this one won’t sense a big pizza sliding to the side.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Buttrick

customer_reviews.title: fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: wonderful critical thinking skills. placement of toppings must be accurate and you must make correct change with the money. hreat game!
customer_reviews.author: C. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids to play and learn basic business skills
customer_reviews.text: This is game for to keep kids attention and teach them how to count and make change. High quality!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Educational
customer_reviews.text: My 4yr old loves this. I also like how you can adjust the levels so he can get more into counting money as he gets a bit older. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: My nephew and family kids loved it! There are some rare glitches but only when the room lighting is poor. We tried it on both iPad air and Fire 7 tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Mona Alemadi

customer_reviews.title: Great game and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this game! It’s so fun and a great way to practice math as well. We bought it for our 6 year old for Christmas but our 10 year old joins in the fun with her. She accidentally spilled her drink on the pizza mat and the company sent us a free replacement within days. We were so impressed at the ease and quick delivery! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: luvmykindle

customer_reviews.title: Fun but sensor issues
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game but there are times after he serves a couple of customers that the game stops registering the "pizza" and won't put it in the "oven." The icon comes up showing the motion but won't register that he's doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Tinisha

customer_reviews.title: We love Osmo!
customer_reviews.text: We have most of the Osmo products! Our two boys have played with them for several years (how many "toys" can you say that about?). We also homeschool and use some of the Osmo products along with our schooling curriculum. I highly recommend OSMO!!!
customer_reviews.author: AndrewZ Crew

customer_reviews.title: Educational and Fun
customer_reviews.text: My Daughter loves this. She can play it for at least an hour. She gets very excited as she gets great scores for making good pizza and having satisfied customers.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Best kids iPad interactive game
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my niece as a Christmas gift to help her with her math and money skills. It’s was a hit with both the kids and adults. Definitely worth buying it teaches them time management, Entrepreneurial skills and how to handle money and provide both cash and coins while learning.
customer_reviews.author: Chelz

customer_reviews.title: Used, and missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: The repackaging was messy. I recall the description saying there may be damage to the package but this was not what i expected. There was a long curly hair in the pieces—gross. It was not organized by sorting of pieces well. And once I did sort the pieces i counted them. This set is missing three money tiles and one topping piece.
customer_reviews.author: Seller Schmitt 20866

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Kids never liked it. I tried it and it was just meh.
customer_reviews.author: JenS

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and can’t wait for the kids to try it out on Christmas
customer_reviews.author: RLZ

customer_reviews.title: Fun to do with my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I love osmo! It is something I like to do too! Often times my daughter wants to play things I don’t really enjoy but we both enjoy osmo! This one is good because it helps her with learning about money — making change , etc
customer_reviews.author: Shop1234

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your Osmo collection.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old is loving this game! I love that he's using math and is enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Learning fun
customer_reviews.text: Great interactive game to help with following directions, paying attention to detail, counting, and adding and subtracting with money.
customer_reviews.author: Niki C.

customer_reviews.title: Just Go for it!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her Christmas Gift!! She’s is excited every chance she gets to play!
customer_reviews.author: Ksjhsn12

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with KID version of the fire tablet
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a great game, but beware while it is compatible with version 8 tablets, this does NOT include the KID version of the tablets (which seems odd, since it is a game for kids).

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old granddaughter and she loves it. Plays with it for hours. She has taken over my iPad. It’s gets harder as she plays so it’s constantly challenging.

customer_reviews.title: The kids enjoy this one
customer_reviews.text: The kids enjoy this one. The math begins pretty easy, but is challenging enough to keep a 10year old entertained. The difficult part is keeping up with the orders! The customers come in pretty fast. If your child is easily overwhelmed, maybe not the game for them.this may not be the game for them.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and educational
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is loving these and I even enjoyed playing it. Teaches great skills and well made.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful learning tool

customer_reviews.title: Great way for kids to learn math!
customer_reviews.text: Love Osmo! This game is so fun! My 6yr old son is having fun learning math and the characters are so funny they keep him entertained. I really enjoy playing it with him. I highly recommend getting this game.
customer_reviews.author: Frank W.

customer_reviews.title: Educational & great eye/hand/thinking coordination!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandsons who are four and six for Christmas. I enjoy playing along with them competing against each other. We are having such a fun time with this game. Highly recommend!! Jane C
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: I am known as the aunt who will give only educational gifts to my nieces and nephews. Purchased this game as a gift for my nephew. He loves it, I love it, and we enjoy playing it together. Very cool to see him learning and having fun at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

product_meta.title: Osmo - Pizza Co. - Ages 5-12 - Communication Skills & Math - For iPad or Fire Tablet (Osmo Base Required)
product_meta.description:
Cooking up math & money skills with the Pizza Co Game from Osmo Run your own pizza shop! Quickly cook pizza & calculate change using toppings & money tiles Invest your profits to upgrade your shop as you bake your way to becoming “the big cheese”! Osmo games bring a child's creative imagination to life with hand held pieces that interact with an iPad and/or Fire Tablet and an Osmo Base (No WiFi necessary for game play) Pizza Co requires an Osmo Base to play and this game does not ship with an Osmo Base An Osmo Base for iPad or Fire Tablet must be purchased to play Pizza Co Approved by parents and teachers worldwide used in over 31 000 classrooms

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
feature_bullets: TEACHING: Make pizza for customers, collect payment & make change (dollars/coins), & learn the profitability of your business. Additional game concepts include: Addition, Subtraction, Fractions, mental math, design and communication skills (Pizza Co.).

SKILLS LEARNED: Real-world (business) math, money, addition, subtraction, fractions, fast paced mental math, run & grow a business, social interaction, listening, critical thinking, oberservation, creative problem solving & basic business concepts. Osmo sees and reacts to every real-life move. Geared towards children & love of learning.

AGE & CAPABILITY: Ages 5-12+. Game is designed for beginner to expert levels. Osmo enables the continuation of learning. Real-time audio and visual feedback lets children learn through experimentation in a stress-free environment.
WHAT'S IN THE BOX: Pizza/Tray, Toppings, Money tiles, Stackable storage for game pieces & 1 Game App: Pizza Co.

COMPATIBILITY FOR IPAD & FIRE TABLET: Compatible iPads: All iPads except Generation 1, iPad Pro 11-inch and iPad Pro 12.9-inch. The minimum iOS version needed is iOS 9. Compatible Fire Tablets: 7th Generation Fire 7, 7th Generation Fire HD 8, 7th Generation Fire HD10, 8th Generation Fire HD 8, 9th Generation Fire 7, 9th Generation Fire HD 10. Currently not compatible with the new Fire HD8 launched May 2020.

OSMO IS MAGIC: Fun-filled & award winning learning games. Children interact with actual hand held pieces & an iPad or Fire Tablet, bringing a child's game pieces & actions to life (No WiFi necessary for game play). Osmo Base and iPad/Fire Tablet not included, required for game play.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
